ja23:1.1: A wounded warhouse urges its rider to take one last stand.
ja23:1.3: _Bhoja_ is a common name or term for a king. The commentary says the _bhojja_ was a stallion from Sindh (today a province of Pakistan). | _Vaḷavā_ is normally “mare”, but here it is masculine ablative, glossed with the masculine _khaluṅkasso_ (“wild colt”, see [an8.14:9.1]()). It is said to be not from Sindh. Monier-Williams defines _vaḍaba_ as “a male horse resembling a mare”, perhaps a gelding.
